tls:text.tls:line: Before Heaven and Earth it was born,

sense.def: originate; come to emerge; be naturally found in (of inanimate subjects), occur naturally in

tls:text.tls:line: and it is only abstract form, without physical shape.

sense.def: to be; to be only (the object in question)

tls:text.tls:line: and it is only abstract form, without physical shape.

sense.def: abstract symbolic shape or image; symbol, symbolisation

tls:text.tls:line: and it is only abstract form, without physical shape.

sense.def: abstract term for the concrete physical visible shape and manifestation of something [Note that paradoxically the notion of "concrete" is highly abstract.]

tls:text.tls:line: it is vastly tranquil, it is diffusely vast;

sense.def: be limpid, tranquil and serene; be unperturbed; be placid (like the sea)

tls:text.tls:line: it is vastly tranquil, it is diffusely vast;
When forced to make a name for it

tls:text.tls:line: yet when one mark it out/points to it, it fills not even one fist.

sense.def: make public, make widely known, advertise openly; mark out

tls:text.tls:line: yet when one mark it out/points to it, it fills not even one fist.

sense.def: fill (primarily a container or a depression in the earth)

tls:text.tls:line: yet when one mark it out/points to it, it fills not even one fist.

sense.def: CHEMLA 2003: outside, exterior part of a mathematical figure. This concept is in this specific sense is particularly common in the commentaries JZ 9, whereas the meaning "gnomon" is attested in the main text of that chapter. The more general meaning "outside" is not specifically relevant to mathematics. When one square is marked out within another as in [ILL 1], the unmarked rectilinear part of the original square is referred to by the technical term jǔ 矩, and this kind of remaining shape in general is called the biǎo 表. In JZ 9.24 矩之表 refers to the remaining part in the shape of (two) jǔ 矩.
